caption.p: Projected biomass trends in relation to global air temperature changes. Shown is the relationship of the change in marine animal biomass to increasing global surface air temperature since preindustrial times (1860s). Each dot represents an annual ensemble mean ( n = 10) relative to 1990–1999 across historical and future emission scenarios (RCPs) in the absence of fishing. Vertical lines frame expected changes between 1.5 °C and 2 °C of warming.
